intro: Codiaeum aureopunctatum, commonly known as the golden dot croton, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, variegated leaves that feature bright yellow dots and streaks against a deep green background. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in warm, humid environments. It produces small, inconspicuous green flowers that are followed by reddish, fleshy fruits. Due to its ornamental value, it is widely cultivated as a houseplant and in gardens.
